jobPostingInfo.title: Office of Research and Development Executive Coordinator
jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Job Details

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

The Executive Staff Coordinator will be a member of the Office of Research and Development staff and report to the 12x Business Manager. You will be working independently under limited supervision and provide confidential business support to the JPL Chief Scientist and Deputy Chief Scientist for Office of Research and Development requiring significant discretion, judgment, tact and subtlety.  In addition, this role also supports the 12x Business Manager and Program/Project Manager(s) within ORD.

Tasks include but not limited to:

  • Represent the Chief Scientist and Deputy Chief Scientist for to all levels of JPL and Caltech personnel, and senior levels of government officials, foreign dignitaries, industry, and academia.

  • Review, evaluate and direct incoming requests for information and action, as appropriate.

  • Delegate routine matters to appropriate parties on own initiative and follow-up to ensure accurate disposition.

  • Interprets applicable internal Laboratory and NASA processes, policies, requirements and procedures.

  • Proactively handle the Chief Scientist and Deputy Chief Scientist for schedules; identify and mitigate potential issues ensure Chief Scientist and Deputy Chief Scientist for remain on schedule; proactively communicate to partners when schedules slip. 

  • Coordinate and lead end-to-end travel plans; provide itineraries and schedules when appropriate. 

  • Anticipate needs of Chief Scientist and Deputy Chief Scientist for in the organization and preparation of meetings, meeting collateral and information bring together for flow down to wider Directorate and/or other collaborators.

  • Support in coordinating and leading NASA Headquarters guests to the Office of Research and Development, compiling itineraries, hosting and chaperoning guests to ensure visits run efficiently.  Research, gather, and prepare presentation materials.

  • Coordinate and lead all aspects of academic tours, submitting visit requests, organizing the agenda, soliciting volunteer speakers and escort as needed.

  • Connect with a wide range of staff to capture and convey information on behalf of the Office of Research and Development.

  • Independently handle and resolve a variety of administrative issues. Actions may have significant impact and solutions require moderate use of creativity and innovation.

  • Assist ORD in leading the Lew Allen and Ed Stone Awards.

  • Coordinate the Senior Research Scientist nomination process.

  • Support program reviews; create agendas, send out communication and coordinate WebEx details during the reviews.

  • May assist with pcard purchases, iProcurement and PR.

  • Planning events (holiday parties, retreats etc.)

  • Submitting DDF requests for 12x

  • May participate in other projects or tasks on an as needed basis.

Qualifications:

  • Typically requires a Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, or related field with a minimum of 1 year of related experience; Master's degree in similar subject areas with a minimum of 0 years of related experience.

  • Confirmed background in anticipating future requests and initiating actions to support the business needs of senior management.

  • Tried experience in effective scheduling of time for a senior executive.

  • Strong proficiency in business software applications including MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).

  • Extensive knowledge and experience in planning and driving travel plans and packages.

  • Extensive experience in providing confidential business support to senior management.

  • Strong background in effectively advising and following up on management action items.

  • Extensive background in dealing with top-level management and high profile contacts.

  • Ability to apply judgment in deciding how to prioritize incoming requests for the executive’s review.

  • Proven track record to partner, communicate and interact effectively at all levels of management, influence others and resolve exciting issues.

  • Ability to initiate and compose correspondence on behalf of an executive.

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

  • Collaborative teammate, willing to make a contribution to all areas of the office.

  • Demonstrated experience in successfully working with all levels of management and high-profile contacts.

  • Consistent record in maintaining a professional demeanor while working in a fast-paced environment.

  • Demonstrated ability to effectively prioritize and coordinate multiple assignments.

  • Ability to perform moderately complex job functions.

Preferred Skills:

  • Extensive knowledge of applicable Laboratory policies and procedures, NASA policies and procedures, and government regulations.

  • Progressive experience displaying growth in responsibility as an executive assistant to senior management.

  • Familiarity with JPL acronyms and terminology.

  • Experience working in outreach, media or education support.

  • Knowledge of appropriate protocols in taking care of high-profile government and foreign officials.

  • May require Foreign National Escort training.

JPL has a catalog of benefits and perks that span from the traditional to the unique. This includes a variety of health, dental, vision, wellbeing, and retirement plans, paid time off, learning, rideshare, childcare, flexible schedule, parental leave and many more. Our focus is on work-life balance, and living healthy, fulfilling lives as we Dare Mighty Things Together. For benefits eligible positions, benefits are effective the first day of the month coincident with or immediately following the employee’s start date.

For further benefits information click Benefits and Perks

The hiring range displayed below is specifically for those who will work in or reside in the location listed. In extending an offer, Jet Propulsion Laboratory considers factors including, but not limited to, the candidate’s job related skills, experience, knowledge, and relevant education/training. Hiring range for this job may be adjusted based on primary work location outside of Pasadena, California. This adjusted range will be provided to candidates by the Recruiter when applicable.

The typical full time equivalent annual hiring range for this job in Pasadena, California.
